title: Imposes criminal sanctions for preventing the disclosure of information available to state agencies regarding the release of toxic substances
summary: Imposes criminal sanctions for preventing the disclosure of information available to state agencies pursuant to provisions of article 37 of the environmental conservation law regarding the release of toxic substances; violation shall be a class E felony.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2588

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to penalties
for preventing the disclosure of information regarding contamination and
the release of toxic substances

PURPOSE/SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill would impose criminal
sanctions for preventing the disclosure of information to local
authorities, regarding the release of toxic substances, when that
information is already available within state agencies.

JUSTIFICATION:
Existing environmental conservation law does not
currently mandate that state agencies divulge certain information,
regarding toxic spills or releases. In the event of prolonged threat
of illness or injury to a community due to the presence of toxic
substances, whether under or above ground, local authorities must
have access to this information in order to help alleviate the
situation as quickly and efficiently as possible. This bill would
facilitate that communication.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None. The information will have already been
processed by the state agency; it just would be shared with other
authorities.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeeding
the date on which it shall have become a law.
